MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> GetEnumerator() cil managed
Public Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator(Of Activity)

summary.span: 实现到 的枚举接口。

span.span: Implements an enumeration interface to the .

returns.span: 返回可循环访问 实例的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that can iterate through the instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用枚举器只能读取集合中的数据。Enumerators only enable reading the data in the collection. 不能使用枚举器修改基础集合。You cannot use enumerators to modify the underlying collection. 开始时，枚举器放在集合中的第一个元素之前。To begin, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 也会将枚举器放回此位置。 also brings the enumerator back to this position. 在此位置，调用 会引发异常。At this position, calling raises an exception. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 或 之前， 返回同一对象。 returns the same object until either or is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 在传递到集合的末尾之后，枚举数放在集合中最后一个元素后面，且调用 会返回 `false`。After the end of the collection is passed, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection, and calling returns `false`. 如果最后一次调用 返回了 `false`，则调用 会引发异常。If the last call to returned `false`, calling raises an exception. 若要再次将 `Current` 设置为集合的第一个元素，可以调用 `Reset` 并接着调用 。To set `Current` to the first element of the collection again, you can call `Reset` followed by . 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对该集合进行了更改（例如添加、修改或删除元素），则该枚举数将变为无效（这一变化是不可逆转的），并且下次调用 或 `Reset` 将引发 。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying or deleting elements, the enumerator is irreversibly invalidated and the next call to or `Reset` raises an . 如果在 和 之间修改集合，那么即使枚举数已经无效， 也将返回它所设置成的元素。If the collection is modified between and , will return the element that it is set to, even if the enumerator is already invalidated. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使在同步集合时，其他线程仍然可以修改该集合。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection. 这会导致枚举器引发异常。This causes the enumerator to raise an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在此上下文中，添加或移除成员会引发事件。In this context, adding or removing members raises the event. 修改成员不会引发事件。Modifying a member does not raise this event. 创建 委托时，需要标识将要处理该事件的方法。When you create an delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. 若要将事件与事件处理程序关联，请将该委托的一个实例添加到事件中。To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. 除非移除了该委托，否则每当发生该事件时就会调用事件处理程序。The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. 有关事件处理程序委托的详细信息，请参阅[处理和引发事件](~/docs/standard/events/index.md)。For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在如何确定对象是否相等方面这些实现可能存在差异；例如， 使用 ，而 允许用户指定 实现以用来对键进行比较。Implementations can vary in how they determine equality of objects; for example, uses , whereas, allows the user to specify the implementation to use for comparing keys. 在由连续的元素组成的集合（如列表）中，已移除元素下面的元素将上移以占据空出的位置。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. 如果集合具有索引，则移动的元素的索引也将更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 此行为不适用于元素按概念划分为不同存储桶的集合，如哈希表。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerator`1<class System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity> System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.GetEnumerator() cil managed
Function GetEnumerator () As IEnumerator(Of Activity) Implements IEnumerable(Of Activity).GetEnumerator

summary.span: 返回一个循环访问集合的枚举器。

span.span: Returns an enumerator that iterates through the collection.

returns.span: 可用于循环访问集合的 。

span.span: An that can be used to iterate through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `foreach` C# 语言的语句 (`for each` c + + 中`For Each`在 Visual Basic 中) 隐藏了枚举数的复杂性。The `foreach` statement of the C# language (`for each` in C++, `For Each` in Visual Basic) hides the complexity of the enumerators. 因此，建议使用 `foreach`，而不是直接操作枚举数。Therefore, using `foreach` is recommended, instead of directly manipulating the enumerator. 枚举器可用于读取集合中的数据，但不能用于修改基础集合。Enumerators can be used to read the data in the collection, but they cannot be used to modify the underlying collection. 最初，枚举数定位在集合中第一个元素的前面。Initially, the enumerator is positioned before the first element in the collection. 在此位置上，未定义 。At this position, is undefined. 因此，在读取 的值之前，必须调用 将枚举器向前移动到集合的第一个元素。Therefore, you must call to advance the enumerator to the first element of the collection before reading the value of . 在调用 之前， 返回相同的对象。 returns the same object until is called. 将 设置为下一个元素。 sets to the next element. 如果 越过集合的末尾，枚举器就会放在此集合中最后一个元素之后，且 将返回 false。If passes the end of the collection, the enumerator is positioned after the last element in the collection and returns false. 当枚举器位于此位置时，对 的后续调用也会返回 false。When the enumerator is at this position, subsequent calls to also return false. 如果对 的最后一次调用返回 false，则 是未定义的。If the last call to returned false, is undefined. 无法再次将 设置为集合的第一个元素；必须改为创建新的枚举器实例。You cannot set to the first element of the collection again; you must create a new enumerator instance instead. 只要集合保持不变，枚举数就保持有效。An enumerator remains valid as long as the collection remains unchanged. 如果对集合进行更改（如添加、修改或删除元素），则枚举数将失效且不可恢复，而且其行为是不确定的。If changes are made to the collection, such as adding, modifying, or deleting elements, the enumerator is irrecoverably invalidated and its behavior is undefined. 枚举数没有对集合的独占访问权；因此，从头到尾对一个集合进行枚举在本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。The enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举过程中锁定集合。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can lock the collection during the entire enumeration. 若要允许多个线程访问集合以进行读写操作，则必须实现自己的同步。To allow the collection to be accessed by multiple threads for reading and writing, you must implement your own synchronization. 命名空间中集合的默认实现是不同步的。Default implementations of collections in the namespace are not synchronized.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通过使用以下语法，此属性提供访问集合中特定元素的能力：myCollection[index]。This property provides the ability to access a specific element in the collection by using the following syntax: myCollection[index]. C# 语言使用 `this` 关键字来定义索引器，而不是实现 `Item` 属性。The C# language uses the `this` keyword to define the indexers instead of implementing the `Item` property. Visual Basic 将 `Item` 实现为默认属性，该属性提供相同的索引功能。Visual Basic implements `Item` as a default property, which provides the same indexing functionality.

exception.span: 不是 中的有效索引。

span.span: is not a valid index in the .
The is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method hidebysig newslot virtual instance void System.Collections.Generic.IList<System.Workflow.ComponentModel.Activity>.RemoveAt(int32 index) cil managed
Sub RemoveAt (index As Integer) Implements IList(Of Activity).RemoveAt

param.name: index
param.span: 要移除的项的从零开始的索引。

span.span: The zero-based index of the item to remove.

summary.span: 移除位于指定索引处的 项。

span.span: Removes the item at the specified index.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 在由连续的元素组成的集合（如列表）中，已移除元素下面的元素将上移以占据空出的位置。In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. 如果集合具有索引，则移动的元素的索引也将更新。If the collection is indexed, the indexes of the elements that are moved are also updated. 此行为不适用于元素按概念划分为不同存储桶的集合，如哈希表。This behavior does not apply to collections where elements are conceptually grouped into buckets, such as a hash table.

exception.span: 不是 中的有效索引。

span.span: is not a valid index in the .
The is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property IsSynchronized As Boolean Implements ICollection.IsSynchronized

summary.span: 获取一个值，该值指示对 的访问是否是同步的，即线程安全的。

span.span: Gets a value that indicates whether access to the is synchronized, that is thread-safe.

value.span: 如果对 的访问是同步的，即线程安全的，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if access to the is synchronized, that is, thread-safe; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回一个对象，该对象可用于同步对 的访问。 returns an object, which can be used to synchronize access to the . 命名空间中的大多数集合类也实现 `Synchronized` 方法，该方法对基础集合提供同步的包装。Most collection classes in the namespace also implement a `Synchronized` method, which provides a synchronized wrapper around the underlying collection. 枚举整个集合本质上不是一个线程安全的过程。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure. 即使某个集合已同步，其他线程仍可以修改该集合，这会导致枚举数引发异常。Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads can still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要确保枚举过程中的线程安全性，可以在整个枚举期间锁定集合，或者捕获由其他线程进行的更改所导致的异常。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the collection during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes made by other threads.

MemberSignature.Value: ReadOnly Property SyncRoot As Object Implements ICollection.SyncRoot

summary.span: 获取可用于同步对 的访问的对象。

span.span: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

value.span: 可用于同步对 的访问的对象。

span.span: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 对于其基础存储区不公用的集合，预期的实现是返回当前实例。For collections whose underlying store is not publicly available, the expected implementation is to return the current instance. 请注意，对于包装了其他集合的集合，指向当前实例的指针可能还不够；这些集合应返回基础集合的 属性。Note that the pointer to the current instance might not be sufficient for collections that wrap other collections; those should return the underlying collection property. 命名空间中的大多数集合类也实现 `Synchronized` 方法，该方法对基础集合提供同步的包装。Most collection classes in the namespace also implement a `Synchronized` method, which provides a synchronized wrapper around the underlying collection. 不过，派生类可使用 属性来提供各自的同步版本的集合。However, derived classes can provide their own synchronized version of the collection using the property. 同步代码必须对集合的 属性执行操作，而不是直接对集合执行操作。The synchronizing code must perform operations on the property of the collection, not directly on the collection. 这样可确保对从其他对象派生的集合正确地执行操作。This ensures proper operation of collections that are derived from other objects. 具体地说，这样可与可能同时对集合实例进行修改的其他线程保持正确的同步。Specifically, it maintains proper synchronization with other threads that might be simultaneously modifying the collection instance.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 具有固定大小的集合在创建之后不能再添加或移除元素，但是允许修改现有元素。A collection with a fixed size does not allow the addition or removal of elements after the collection is created, but it allows the modification of existing elements.
